wesm commented on pull request #6140: ARROW-7492:	[CI][Crossbow] Nightly homebrew-cpp job fails on Python installation
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6140#discussion_r364375788
 
 

 ##########
 File path: dev/tasks/homebrew-formulae/apache-arrow.rb
 ##########
 @@ -15,7 +15,7 @@ class ApacheArrow < Formula
   depends_on "numpy"
   depends_on "openssl@1.1"
   depends_on "protobuf"
-  depends_on "python"
+  depends_on "python@2"
 
 Review comment:
   That's a bit evil. Do we want to build ARROW_PYTHON at all in the Homebrew recipe? 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

nealrichardson commented on pull request #6140: ARROW-7492:	[CI][Crossbow] Nightly homebrew-cpp job fails on Python installation
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6140#discussion_r364377980
 
 

 ##########
 File path: dev/tasks/homebrew-formulae/apache-arrow.rb
 ##########
 @@ -15,7 +15,7 @@ class ApacheArrow < Formula
   depends_on "numpy"
   depends_on "openssl@1.1"
   depends_on "protobuf"
-  depends_on "python"
+  depends_on "python@2"
 
 Review comment:
   I was just trying it, but in hindsight I don't think it will work (PYTHON_EXECUTABLE looks for python3).
   
   My next attempt is removing python2: there was this suggestion on the failed job that I missed before https://travis-ci.org/ursa-labs/crossbow/builds/631795636#L1793
   
   If that fails, then we may have to turn off ARROW_PYTHON for now, unless someone has a better idea.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

nealrichardson commented on issue #6140: ARROW-7492:	[CI][Crossbow] Nightly homebrew-cpp job fails on Python installation
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6140#issuecomment-572328452
 
 
   The original build failure has been resolved (by `brew unlink python@2`). Fixing that issue exposed a new failure/bug in the `brew test` command that appears to have been introduced by homebrew on January 2, while our job was already failing. See https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/issues/6908 for details. I've skipped the `brew test` command for now.
   
   IMO we should merge this now and deal with unskipping `brew test` if/when that gets fixed upstream.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kszucs commented on issue #6140: ARROW-7492:	[CI][Crossbow] Nightly homebrew-cpp job fails on Python installation
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6140#issuecomment-572520039
 
 
   Agree. The brew recipes are built be the home-brew ecosystem, so a faulty package won't go through, meanwhile we can still test that it builds.
   
   @nealrichardson please add a jira to track that we'll need to re-enable brew-test.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
